content.title: Overview
content.content: I was approached with an opportunity to design and build a university doctoral program website. To my surprise, there was no visual guidelines that I had to adhere to. Furthermore I was explicitly asked to make it look modern and as exciting as the clients were about this new program

metadata.title: Tools
metadata.content: HTML, CSS, JS, Ruby on Rails, Node.js, GitHub

content.title: Problem
content.content: With university program websites being developed independently with little to no brand / design guidelines, the lack of consistency meant I had creative control but also no clear direction. With a lack of clarity in what MACS wanted visually, it was clear that I needed to learn more about their target audience as well as their goals with the outcome of the website.

content.title: Research

With a lack of clarity in what MACS wanted visually, it was clear that I needed to learn more about their target audience as well as their goals with the outcome of the website.
“Students want the important information as fast as possible.”

lists.title: Technical
list: Design a website that highlights the work the program and its faculty do
Make the website beautiful yet simple in terms of usability
Create a site that is consistent throughout all device sizes
Make the content easily editable from the site maintainers side
Complete the site as quickly as possible, though given until the end of the year

lists.title: Personal
list: Write clear code through verbose naming via BEM
Become more proficient in WordPress (with previous experience limited to editing content and installing plugins)
